Then Jonah prayed unto the LORD his God out of the fish's belly,

And said, I cried by reason of mine affliction unto the LORD, and he heard me; out of the belly of hell cried I, <FI>and<Fi> thou heardest my voice.<RF>byâ€¦: or, out of mine affliction<Rf><RF>hell: or, the grave<Rf>
For thou hadst cast me into the deep, in the midst of the seas; and the floods compassed me about: all thy billows and thy waves passed over me.<RF>midst: Heb. heart<Rf>
Then I said, I am cast out of thy sight; yet I will look again toward thy holy temple.
The waters compassed me about, <FI>even<Fi> to the soul: the depth closed me round about, the weeds were wrapped about my head.

I went down to the bottoms of the mountains; the earth with her bars <FI>was<Fi> about me for ever: yet hast thou brought up my life from corruption, O LORD my God.<RF>bottoms: Heb. cuttings off<Rf><RF>corruption: or, the pit<Rf>
When my soul fainted within me I remembered the LORD: and my prayer came in unto thee, into thine holy temple.
They that observe lying vanities forsake their own mercy.
But I will sacrifice unto thee with the voice of thanksgiving; I will pay <FI>that<Fi> that I have vowed. Salvation <FI>is<Fi> of the LORD.<CM>
And the LORD spake unto the fish, and it vomited out Jonah upon the dry <FI>land<Fi>.<CM>
